channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harvard Researchers: Use the 7-Hour Rule to Squeeze the Most Joy Out of Your Free Time
item.description: You’re strategic about how you use your working hours. You should be equally strategic about getting the most out of your free time.

item.title: Gen Alpha has surpassed $100 billion in spending power from side hustles and bankrolling parents—and Roblox and Nike are among the big winners
item.description: “This generation has more spending money than you'd think,” DKC President Matthew Traub said. “Their economic influence is enormous.”

item.title: You Shouldn’t Pass Tariff Costs On to Customers. Here’s Why
item.description: Passing the cost of tariffs directly to customers may seem logical, but customer relationships are emotional. Do this instead.

item.title: As Tariff Turmoil Continues, This Growing Revenue Stream May Provide a Lifeline
item.description: The market for secondhand apparel is expanding. That presents a huge opportunity for brand buy-in.

item.title: Want to Get Into This Retailer? Founders Say Be Prepared for a ‘War Zone of Competition’
item.description: How upstart brands have persuaded Sephora to give their company a chance online and on-shelf.

item.title: India reacts to Trump’s 50% tariffs with pause on U.S. weapons purchase
item.description: New Delhi has put on hold its plans to procure new U.S. weapons and aircraft, according to three Indian officials familiar with the matter, in India’s...

item.title: The dollar is in decline because of a global ‘loss of faith in U.S. leadership,’ Macquarie says
item.description: The U.S.’s rough treatment of its former allies is one explanation for the weakening dollar, according to Macquarie analyst Thierry Wizman.

item.title: Housing market supply is finally back in these 80 metro areas—and it’s good news for buyers
item.description: Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter . During the Pandemic Housing Boom,...

item.title: Oil prices are projected to continue sliding. Here’s why
item.description: Oil prices edged higher on Friday but were poised for the steepest weekly losses since late June on a tariff-hit economic outlook and a potential meet...

item.title: I’ve helped some of New York’s wealthiest ramp up their giving. Zohran Mamdani’s rise reveals the urgency — and opportunity — for all of us to meet the moment
item.description: The public is rebelling, and a close look at the data reveals why.

item.title: Why America’s jobs data may be getting it wrong
item.description: The rise of entrepreneurship and AI-driven solopreneurs is reshaping the labor market—but U.S. data hasn’t caught up.

item.title: Pinterest is winning over Gen Z and finding success with AI, but the stock price is down double digits today
item.description: Pinterest reported its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, August 7, and, in many ways, it was good news—though you wouldn’t know it from how much it...

item.title: Your Employees With Student Loans Are Struggling, and It’s About to Get Worse
item.description: Data shows more employees are falling behind on student loan payments, but companies can offer mutually beneficial solutions.

item.title: What to know about the spat of sex-toy incidents the WNBA is dealing with
item.description: The WNBA is still struggling with a string of sex-toy disturbances. In the past week and a half, sex toys have been thrown on court during games in At...

item.title: What to know about Stephen Miran, the tariff proponent Trump just nominated to join the Fed’s board of governors
item.description: Miran is a rarity, a highly trained economist who makes a logical-sounding case for Trump’s stunningly contrarian game plan.
